The popularity of Sarah J. Maas’s books is evident in the impressive sales figures across her various series. Her most popular series, “Throne of Glass,” has sold millions of copies worldwide, encompassing a range of formats including paperback, ebook, and audiobook.

The royalties earned by Sarah J. Maas from book sales depend on several factors, including her publisher contracts and the percentage of sales she receives. Generally, authors receive a royalty percentage of the net sales price of their books.

The royalty rate can vary based on the type of contract, the publisher, and the sales volume. For example, a traditional publishing contract might grant an author a royalty rate of 10% to 15% of the net sales price for the first 10,000 copies sold, increasing to 15% to 20% for subsequent sales.

Royalty rates are generally a percentage of the net sales price, which is the retail price minus the costs of production, distribution, and marketing.
